intro: Scabiosa succisa var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink, white, and purple. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are usually hairy and somewhat woody. This species is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and its ability to attract pollinators like butterflies and bees.
